slokas: अर्जुन उवाचएवं सततयुक्ता ये भक्तास्त्वां पर्युपासते ।ये चाप्यक्षरमव्यक्तं तेषां के योगवित्तमा: ॥ १ ॥
slokas_translated: Arjuna said: Those devotees who, ever steadfast, thus worship You, and those who worship the imperishable and the unmanifested — which of them are better versed in Yoga?

slokas: श्रीभगवानुवाचमय्यावेश्य मनो ये मां नित्ययुक्ता उपासते ।श्रद्धया परयोपेतास्ते मे युक्ततमा मता: ॥ २ ॥
slokas_translated: The Blessed Lord said: Those who, having fixed their mind on Me, worship Me, ever steadfast and endowed with supreme faith, are considered by Me to be the most united in yoga.

slokas: ये त्वक्षरमनिर्देश्यमव्यक्तं पर्युपासते ।सर्वत्रगमचिन्त्यं च कूटस्थमचलं ध्रुवम् ॥ ३ ॥
slokas_translated: Those who worship the imperishable, indefinable, unmanifest, all-pervading, inconceivable, unchanging, immovable, and eternal...

slokas: सन्नियम्येन्द्रियग्रामं सर्वत्र समबुद्धय: ।ते प्राप्‍नुवन्ति मामेव सर्वभूतहिते रता: ॥ ४ ॥
slokas_translated: Having restrained all the senses, being of even mind everywhere, they, devoted to the welfare of all beings, attain Me alone.

slokas: क्ल‍ेशोऽधिकतरस्तेषामव्यक्तासक्तचेतसाम् ।अव्यक्ता हि गतिर्दु:खं देहवद्भ‍िरवाप्यते ॥ ५ ॥
slokas_translated: The difficulty is greater for those whose minds are attached to the unmanifest; for the goal of the unmanifest is attained with suffering by the embodied.

slokas: ये तु सर्वाणि कर्माणि मयि सन्न्यस्य मत्परा: ।अनन्येनैव योगेन मां ध्यायन्त उपासते ॥ ६ ॥
slokas_translated: Those who, dedicating all actions to Me, regarding Me as the Supreme, meditate on Me with exclusive devotion through undivided yoga, they worship Me.

slokas: तेषामहं समुद्धर्ता मृत्युसंसारसागरात् ।भवामि न चिरात्पार्थ मय्यावेशितचेतसाम् ॥ ७ ॥
slokas_translated: I am the deliverer from the ocean of death and rebirth for those whose minds are absorbed in Me, O Partha, and I become so without delay.

slokas: मय्येव मन आधत्स्व मयि बुद्धिं निवेशय ।निवसिष्यसि मय्येव अत ऊर्ध्वं न संशय: ॥ ८ ॥
slokas_translated: Fix your mind on Me alone, place your intellect in Me; thereafter you will dwell in Me alone, without doubt.

slokas: अथ चित्तं समाधातुं न शक्न‍ोषि मयि स्थिरम् ।अभ्यासयोगेन ततो मामिच्छाप्‍तुं धनञ्जय ॥ ९ ॥
slokas_translated: If you are unable to fix your mind steadily on Me, then seek to attain Me through the practice of yoga, O Dhananjaya (Arjuna).

slokas: अभ्यासेऽप्यसमर्थोऽसि मत्कर्मपरमो भव ।मदर्थमपि कर्माणि कुर्वन्सिद्धिमवाप्स्यसि ॥ १० ॥
slokas_translated: If you are unable to practice, be intent on performing actions for me. By performing actions for my sake, you will attain perfection.

slokas: अथैतदप्यशक्तोऽसि कर्तुं मद्योगमाश्रित: ।सर्वकर्मफलत्यागं तत: कुरु यतात्मवान् ॥ ११ ॥
slokas_translated: If you are unable to do even this, then taking refuge in union with Me, renounce the fruits of all actions with a controlled mind.

slokas: श्रेयो हि ज्ञानमभ्यासाज्ज्ञानाद्ध्यानं विशिष्यते ।ध्यानात्कर्मफलत्यागस्त्यागाच्छान्तिरनन्तरम् ॥ १२ ॥
slokas_translated: Better indeed is knowledge than practice; than knowledge, meditation is more esteemed. Than meditation, the renunciation of the fruits of actions; after renunciation, peace follows immediately.

slokas: अद्वेष्टा सर्वभूतानां मैत्र: करुण एव च ।निर्ममो निरहङ्कार: समदु:खसुख: क्षमी ॥ १३ ॥
slokas_translated: Non-envious towards all beings, friendly and compassionate, free from attachment and ego, even-minded in pain and pleasure, forgiving.

slokas: सन्तुष्ट: सततं योगी यतात्मा दृढनिश्चय: ।मय्यर्पितमनोबुद्धिर्यो मद्भ‍क्त: स मे प्रिय: ॥ १४ ॥
slokas_translated: The one who is content, constantly practicing yoga, self-controlled, with firm determination, whose mind and intellect are dedicated to me, such a devotee is dear to me.

slokas: यस्मान्नोद्विजते लोको लोकान्नोद्विजते च य: ।हर्षामर्षभयोद्वेगैर्मुक्तो य: स च मे प्रिय: ॥ १५ ॥
slokas_translated: He by whom the world is not disturbed and who is not disturbed by the world, who is free from joy, anger, fear, and anxiety, he is dear to Me.

slokas: अनपेक्ष: श‍ुचिर्दक्ष उदासीनो गतव्यथ: ।सर्वारम्भपरित्यागी यो मद्भ‍क्त: स मे प्रिय: ॥ १६ ॥
slokas_translated: Free from desires, pure, skilled, impartial, free from distress, and renouncing all undertakings—such a devotee of mine is dear to me.

slokas: यो न हृष्यति न द्वेष्टि न शोचति न काङ्‍क्षति ।श‍ुभाश‍ुभपरित्यागी भक्तिमान्य: स मे प्रिय: ॥ १७ ॥
slokas_translated: He who neither rejoices nor hates, neither grieves nor desires, who renounces both good and evil, full of devotion, he is dear to Me.

slokas: सम: शत्रौ च मित्रे च तथा मानापमानयो: ।शीतोष्णसुखदु:खेषु सम: सङ्गविवर्जित: ॥ १८ ॥
slokas_translated: The same in enemy and friend, and also in honor and dishonor; the same in cold, heat, pleasure, and pain; free from attachment.

slokas: तुल्यनिन्दास्तुतिर्मौनी सन्तुष्टो येन केनचित् ।अनिकेत: स्थिरमतिर्भक्तिमान्मे प्रियो नर: ॥ १९ ॥
slokas_translated: A person who is equanimous in praise and blame, silent, content with anything, without attachment to a home, firm in mind, and full of devotion is dear to me.

slokas: ये तु धर्मामृतमिदं यथोक्तं पर्युपासते ।श्रद्दधाना मत्परमा भक्तास्तेऽतीव मे प्रिया: ॥ २० ॥
slokas_translated: Those who, with faith and devotion, follow this nectar of righteousness as declared, making Me their supreme goal, are exceedingly dear to Me.
